project: SkyNav X200 — UAV Flight Control System

requirements.text: The Flight_Controller shall process each inertial measurement unit update within 10 ± 1 ms of sensor data acquisition.
requirements.rationale: DO-178C DAL-A timing requirement for flight-critical loop.

requirements.text: The Navigation_System shall compute the aircraft position with an accuracy of ±2.5 m CEP under GPS-available conditions.
requirements.rationale: Required for BVLOS operations per STANAG 4586.

requirements.text: When GPS signal is lost, the Navigation_System shall switch to inertial-only navigation within 50 ms of signal loss detection.
requirements.rationale: Seamless navigation continuity during GPS-denied operations.

requirements.text: The Flight_Controller shall maintain stable flight within ±2° of commanded attitude in wind conditions up to 25 ± 2 knots.
requirements.rationale: Operational envelope includes moderate wind conditions per MIL-STD-1797.

requirements.text: The Autopilot_Module shall execute each waypoint transition within 500 ± 50 m of the planned flight path.
requirements.rationale: Airspace compliance for controlled corridor operations.

requirements.text: The Communication_Link shall transmit telemetry data to the Ground_Station at a rate of 10 Hz with a maximum latency of 200 ± 20 ms.
requirements.rationale: Real-time situational awareness for remote pilot.

requirements.text: The Flight_Controller shall detect each engine failure within 100 ms of occurrence and initiate the emergency landing sequence.
requirements.rationale: ARP 4754A safety objective for catastrophic failure condition.

requirements.text: The Power_Distribution_Unit shall provide redundant power paths to the Flight_Controller with automatic failover within 5 ± 1 ms.
The Encryption_Module shall encrypt each command-and-control link using AES-256 with key rotation every 3600 ± 60 seconds.
The Flight_Controller shall log each flight parameter at a minimum rate of 50 Hz to the non-volatile Flight_Data_Recorder.
requirements.rationale: Post-flight analysis and incident investigation capability.

requirements.text: The Obstacle_Detection_System shall identify each obstacle larger than 0.5 m at a range of 30 ± 3 m during forward flight.
requirements.rationale: Detect and avoid capability for BVLOS operations.

requirements.text: The Airframe shall withstand a load factor of 3.5g without structural deformation per MIL-STD-1530.
requirements.rationale: Structural integrity during maximum manoeuvre loading.

decisions.title: Triple-redundant IMU architecture
decisions.desc: Selected triple-redundant IMU with majority voting over dual-redundant with cross-checking.
decisions.rationale: ARP 4754A DAL-A requires tolerance to dual simultaneous failures.

decisions.title: DO-178C DAL-A for flight control software
decisions.desc: Flight control software classified as DAL-A (catastrophic failure condition).
decisions.rationale: Engine-out scenario classified as catastrophic per FHA.

risks.title: GPS spoofing attack on navigation
risks.desc: Adversarial GPS spoofing could cause position errors beyond acceptable limits.
risks.mitigation: Integrated INS cross-check with spoofing detection algorithm.

risks.title: IMU calibration drift over flight duration
risks.desc: Inertial sensor drift may exceed position accuracy requirements during extended BVLOS flights.
risks.mitigation: Periodic GPS correction when available; investigate enhanced INS.

risks.title: C2 link loss in urban canyon
risks.desc: Command and control link may be lost due to multipath and obstruction in dense urban environments.
risks.mitigation: Autonomous return-to-home procedure with geofence compliance.

stakeholders.name: Remote Pilot
stakeholders.concerns: Real-time situational awareness, reliable C2 link, emergency override
stakeholders.expectations: Intuitive GCS interface, sub-second command response

stakeholders.name: Airframe Maintenance Crew
stakeholders.concerns: Diagnostic access, LRU replaceability, maintenance intervals

useCases.name: BVLOS Corridor Flight
useCases.preconditions: Pre-flight checks complete, GPS lock acquired, C2 link established
useCases.mainFlow:
1. Pilot initiates auto-takeoff
2. System climbs to cruise altitude
3. Autopilot follows waypoint route
4. System transmits telemetry at 10 Hz
5. Pilot monitors and can override
6. System executes auto-landing at destination
useCases.postconditions: Aircraft on ground, flight data recorded

useCases.name: Engine Failure Emergency
useCases.mainFlow:
1. Flight Controller detects engine failure
2. System alerts Remote Pilot
3. Autopilot initiates emergency descent profile
4. System identifies nearest safe landing zone
5. System executes autorotation/glide landing
6. System transmits emergency beacon

glossary.def: Beyond Visual Line of Sight — operations where the remote pilot cannot see the aircraft directly
Design Assurance Level — DO-178C/DO-254 classification (A=Catastrophic through E=No Effect)
Circular Error Probable — radius of circle containing 50% of position fixes
Inertial Measurement Unit — accelerometers + gyroscopes for attitude/position estimation
Command and Control — datalink between ground station and aircraft
Line Replaceable Unit — modular component replaceable at the flight line level
